definitions: To depart, especially for an aircraft.
To achieve sudden popularity or success.
To deduct an amount from a total.
To have a period of time away from work or duties.
examples: Please take off your shoes before entering.
The plane will take off in five minutes.
He had to take off when he got the call.
Her career really took off after that movie.
He can take off his teacher perfectly.
They offered to take off 10% for cash.
I need to take off a few days next week.
